storyInfo: Tippi visits Moira in prison. 'Lady Dupont' rouses controversy and becomes a film festival's hottest topic. The new Tragodia, Lucian, meets the Playwright and Shalem in a cinema, and they prepare for their new journey.

attributes.content: <p=1>Columbia, Wrankwood Outskirts, Federal Nomadic Prison</><p=2>Two months later</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Molly, you've lost so much weight!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I did spend two whole months in bed.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I went looking for you once the plate stopped. When I saw medics carrying you out all covered in blood, and you weren't moving, I thought you were dead...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: His singing voice is... terrifying.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: But he only wanted to stop me. He didn't want to kill me.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: It definitely wasn't a coincidence that he bumped into Greta at the auction, like she said. He had another motive to join the film crew.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: And what was that?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: He was looking for something that exists, something that's always with us, even though we know nothing about it.
attributes.name: Moira
Tippi
attributes.content: Okay... I knew he was a mysterious dude, but now I'm even more confused.

attributes.name: Tippi
attributes.content: But forget about him!
attributes.joined: Okay... I knew he was a mysterious dude, but now I'm even more confused.But forget about him!

attributes.content: I'm sorry for taking so long to come see you. Mostly because they make it a real pain to file a visitation application for this place.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I know, Tippi.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: But I used you and caused others to misunderstand you...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Lucian was right. I was ignoring the truth in my hands. In my final moments of madness, I didn't even... think of you...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Listen to me, Molly.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: No matter what you went through, no matter what your goal, you hurt the people who were by our side practically twenty-four seven. You're a criminal, and I won't ever forgive you for that!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: ...But that doesn't mean I can't also miss the times we would crash on the sofa to watch horror flicks, just the two of us.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Wasn't that fun? Wasn't that, like, real?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: ...Yeah.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: When I was stuck in bed, my wounds hurt so bad I couldn't sleep. I kept recalling everything that happened...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: A whole night would pass, but only my pain was real.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Honestly, it doesn't matter how absurd a story gets, or if we're all puppets of fate or whatever. It's not like I never had a choice.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: If only I'd focused more on the movies we were watching, instead of thinking about the truth I thought was real—hatred, madness, blood, and puppets.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Tippi.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: If I'd met you earlier, maybe you wouldn't have even needed 'Laura'.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: The final day of your trial's in two days, right? I talked to a few lawyers, and it seems like...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Don't let my ending bother you.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: The warden's nice here. He let me stay in the prison's logistics department during these last few days, to make stuff the prisoners can use.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: I'm not living like I was before, merely waiting in vain for the finale.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Good, good.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Haha, you're almost out of visiting time, so let's talk about happier stuff.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: What happened to the movie we all shot together?
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: <p=1>Columbia, central Wrankwood, 'Avant-Garde Film Festival' venue</><p=2>One day ago</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Wow, everyone's here already! Sorry I'm late!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Nervous, Steven?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: A bit.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Relax.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: We shot that ridiculous finale, and then it went to editing, color grading, and music production... Everyone did their best to complete production in only two months.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I'm glad we agreed on the title change, Steven.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I should be thanking you again for your final performance inside the Catastrophe. Otherwise, deleting those three words would've been nothing but pretentious navel-gazing.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Lady Dupont is by no means as attention-grabbing as The Death of Lady Dupont, but let Greta worry about the marketing... There is no doubt in my mind that our new title suits the story best.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Right, I'll handle it.
attributes.name: Greta
Greta
attributes.content: I'll get Lady Dupont into theaters...

attributes.name: Greta
attributes.content: then visit a police station to do what I have to do.
attributes.joined: I'll get Lady Dupont into theaters... then visit a police station to do what I have to do.

attributes.content: Pinch me. I'm not seeing things, am I?
attributes.name: Excited Reporter A

attributes.content: Pinch you? Just snap your shutter already! This is guaranteed to go on the front page tomorrow!
attributes.name: Excited Reporter B

attributes.content: How did the niche AGFF attract such a distinguished guest? How much did the organizers spend?
attributes.name: Excited Reporter B

attributes.content: How many years has it been since Marianne Blake showed up in Wrankwood?
attributes.name: Excited Reporter A

attributes.content: Grandma Jara!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: It's been a while, Tip.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Judging by your outfit... let me guess what your role in this was. Script supervisor? Prop master? Stuntwoman? Or some kind of 'Furniture City Warrior'?
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Background painter, of course!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I've been in this crew for half a year, and was even selected to join the Wrankwood studio plate restoration project last week!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: The plate our crew rented got totally wrecked by the Catastrophe, so the boss put me in charge of the design work once it's rebuilt, and I've been, like, soooo busy...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Haha, I see you've finally figured out what you want to do.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: I told you before, didn't I? I love movies, every last part of them!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: And now, I finally found out what my favorite part is!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: So, you don't plan on going back?
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Hehe, think you could keep shielding me from the old man?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Tip, your grandfather may be an old friend of mine who used to be my finest partner in the industry, but that doesn't mean he'll let me tell him how to raise his grandkids.
attributes.name: Jara
Tippi
attributes.content: Just tell him this the next time you have tea with him:

attributes.name: Tippi
attributes.content: Ahem—
attributes.joined: Just tell him this the next time you have tea with him:Ahem—

attributes.content: 'We're all retired, aren't we, old chap? Why waste our time worrying about the little things?'
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: 'I know Tip didn't use any of your contacts, nor did she follow your plan to become a historical film director, but isn't she living it up in Wrankwood?'
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: 'Who knows, half the backdrops in town might be spray-painted by your granddaughter one day!'
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Alright, I recorded all that. I'll play it for him the next time we meet.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: ...Aw, Grandma Jara!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Fine, fine. But I might not have the time to see your grandpa the next time I'm in Columbia.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Oh yeah, didn't you go all the way to Rim Billiton for some fresh air? Did you come back for Rhine Lab stuff?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: That's too many questions, Tip.
attributes.name: Jara
Jara
attributes.content: Once the screening's done, I have to head over to Max D.C. to see the vice president...

attributes.name: Jara
attributes.content: So at least let me have a chat with an old friend, will you?
attributes.joined: Once the screening's done, I have to head over to Max D.C. to see the vice president...So at least let me have a chat with an old friend, will you?

attributes.content: Long time no see, Marianne.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Just call me Jara.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: After so many years away from the silver screen, 'Marianne' sounds like a stranger's name to me.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Either way, I have to thank you... Jara.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I'm sure you know that given my current reputation, I don't have much of an influence in the industry anymore.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: So without your help, the AGFF would never have allowed Lady Dupont as a late submission.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: It was my pleasure.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Though, I must say, I had no idea that Tippi was actually—
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I would have helped you with or without her.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: I just watched the part with the Catastrophe, and felt it'd be such a pity for the audience to miss out on the actress's performance. So I thought I'd do an old friend a favor.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: But even if Lady Dupont gets free marketing at AGFF, that doesn't always translate into box office numbers.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Melanie, you know better than I that if Wrankwood were a person, he would be the most forgetful and least-tolerant person there is.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: ...It's no guarantee that he'd accept a lover running back into his arms.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Besides, you did destroy an entire plate. Even if the film's a smash hit, you might not make enough to pay for the damages.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: At least I did it. And I have no regrets.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: But rather than mulling over all that, I'd like to... ask you a question.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: When you encountered a Catastrophe while shooting The Eternally Shining Star, the camera caught you as the storm nearly missed you...
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Was it just an accident, like you said at the press conference, or...
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Did you also move toward it of your own will?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Is the answer to that still important to you, even now?
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.content: Hahahaha. No.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: *sigh* It sure is hard to say if I really did beat you in the end!
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: The splendidly dressed female lead laughs heartily before every camera in the room, though she does not even know what she is laughing at.

After a long time, she opens her arms towards her former rival, the genius she always thought she would never catch up to, the one she had always exchanged polite greetings with on camera, for a hug...
And it is returned in kind.
Let's head in.
attributes.name: Jara

attributes.text: Art Department   Carl, Bob, Tippi, Jericho...

attributes.content: ...It's over?
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: Yup.
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: Thoughts on the film?
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: I heard about what happened behind the scenes—the murders, the Catastrophe, even the project management was a mess.
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: So before I sat down to watch it, I thought the film couldn't possibly live up to all that. But...
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: An absurd noble's marriage breakdown ending with a Catastrophe—the plot twists made sense, but so many of the characters were just bizarre...
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: It's hard to say if it's good or bad, but it's a lot to chew on.
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: Same, to be honest.
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: Story aside, even the production was pretty controversial. Like, the cinematography is inconsistent at times...
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: The first part was shot meticulously like a serious historical drama, but it becomes rougher and rougher towards the end, especially the Catastrophe scenes, where it's totally filmed like a documentary!
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: It's definitely going to be polarizing. The fans will rate it highly, while the haters are going to hate it.
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: But that's what makes it interesting, isn't it?
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: Wrankwood's been getting more and more boring over the years, and that goes for AGFF films too...
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: But this one? I'd buy a ticket to Lady Dupont.
attributes.name: Audience Member B

attributes.content: Let's see what the director and cast have to say during the post-screening round table.
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: Oh yeah, I heard that unlucky-looking gal in the front worked on it too...
attributes.name: Audience Member A

attributes.content: Hoo boy... My luck is awful.
attributes.name: Hautin

attributes.content: After a month of applications, I finally landed a spot as their last stagehand, but then all of that happened the moment I arrived on set. I lost so much sleep after running into those corpses...
attributes.name: Hautin

attributes.content: And if it weren't for the insomnia, I wouldn't have kicked the wall with my mind all messed up, and broken my leg when I was trying to follow everyone down to safety when the Catastrophe came near...
attributes.name: Hautin

attributes.content: And if I didn't break my leg, I wouldn't have missed my bus and missed the first half of the screening...
attributes.name: Hautin

attributes.content: The unlucky stagehand mutters to herself as the credits roll. She recalls her experience and cannot help but feel sorrowful about it all.
Even the images on the screen feel strange to her. The familiar faces and scenes have all been assembled in a way she cannot understand...
Just like her 'topsy-turvy' life.
Then, she spots her name at the end of the credits.
'Stage Department: Hautin'...
attributes.name: Hautin

attributes.content: No matter how the hand of fate may change, it will eventually leave a line, a truth you believe in.
It's over. Aren't you taking part in the post-screening round table?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: I'm not with them. Besides... the two of you are here.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Hah, true enough.
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Yes, it was wonderful... Be it the film itself or otherwise.
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Lucian...
attributes.name: Shalem

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Is he dead for good this time?
attributes.name: Shalem

attributes.content: Or is he still alive somehow?
attributes.name: Shalem

attributes.content: I'd have to think about that.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: But all you need to know, Shalem, is that you won't have to worry about shadows from the past invading your dreams—even when you're on Rhodes Island—ever again.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: And Playwright, you may write your scripts as you wish. About any topic, in any style.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: The Crimson Troupe is no more. You two are free.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: And you?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: You just said you'd have to think about his ending—which means you're stuck on that path, correct?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: 'Drama never dies'... So is the one sitting beside me right now no longer 'Blood Diamond', but 'Tragodia'?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: It sounds like you've paid a heavy price, Lucian.
attributes.name: Shalem

attributes.content: I wouldn't say so.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: If our previous attempts at escape or revenge were just scripts for us to follow, then now, we can finally step into the future.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I will travel again, sing and perform again, until I am certain that what I create manages to match my joy and pain.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: It could be a new troupe or a new proposition, new adventures and new stories. Or, a more dazzling tomorrow, a more tragic truth...
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Hey, Shalem. We're all buddies here... would you like to lend him a hand?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Lucian, a-are you sure about this?
attributes.name: Shalem

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Those who've lost themselves in their haste. The ascetics who've closed off their senses and their selves. The laypeople who trudge through both highs and lows. And the creatures who chew on their pain.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: This land has never lacked for actors.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: ...So I welcome you both to join the 'troupe'.
attributes.name: Lucian
